loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his shop.

loans.name: Sergo

texts.en:
Sergo, 59 years old, lives in the village of Tserovani with his wife, who takes care of the family, and grown daughter. Sergo has a high school education but works as a driver at the local municipality. His daughter is a technician at the candy factory. Both earn small monthly salaries.

Sergo is a very hardworking person who puts family first, but he is unable to provide them with enough income. He has therefore decided to start his own car wash with the help of a loan that he requested from MFO Credo; the application was approved within the framework of a startup program that enables inexperienced borrowers to begin new businesses.

Sergo owns a commercial space, and with the loan will purchase essential equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, hoses and power washers. He will provide services to local community members and hopes to generate income. The new business initiative will significantly improve the living conditions of his family and give Sergo financial stability. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a car wash

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables for resale. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and the high cost of transportation in the business.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for her business. She joined Yehu because of favorable lending policies.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, beans and paraffin for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of her son's tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Ikrom

texts.en:
Ikrom is a 42-year-old man, married, and the father of 6 children. Two of them are adults and four of them are non-adults.

He has been farming for more than 14 years. Thanks to his good experience in this field, his harvest from growing wheat and potatoes was good. However, it does not allow him to provide for the needs of his family as well as to build a new house. His family is large and needs to live in a big house. 

This year he is going to build a new house with modern planning. He plans that his new house will have bedrooms, a large living room and a verandah. His son wants to be married to a lovely girl this year and they will live in the new house.

This loan will help Ikrom to buy building materials to build the new house. In this way he will provide high quality living conditions for his family and put an end to the problems with housing.

loans.use: To buy building materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en:
Mavzuna is 26 years old. She is married and has two children. Her children are non-adults. 

Mavzuna has her own business. She manages her business alone. She began selling children's clothes two years ago. Little by little, over time she has perfected her knowledge about business and has developed her business. She sells her goods in the local market. She is an honest and kind woman and that’s why she is respected by the local people. Her husband is also a businessman. He sells men's clothes. 

Now, she wants to increase her working capital. In addition to selling clothing she wants to sell home products. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 USD to buy home products. This is her third loan from IMON. She has a good credit history. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy home products to sell

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 30 years old, from Nyandarua South, and is married with three children who are between the ages of 12 and 5 years old.

Monica is a farmer and has been in this business for the past 4 years. She has applied for a second loan from KADET Ltd to enable her to buy fertilizers and seedlings to use on her farm.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and employ workers to help her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seedlings.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Shirley is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carren

texts.en:
Carren is a hardworking woman who lives in Voi. She operates a retail shop, and her dream is to have a wholesale shop in the future. She cites competition as her major challenge.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, sacks of potatoes and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, sacks of potatoes and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is 33 years old and lives in the village of Norio with his family: his wife, two school-aged sons and his father. Zurab breeds sheep and earns a living with an animal husbandry business. Zurab’s father is involved in a fuel trading business and sells benzene among the locals. He makes a monthly profit but the existing income is not enough for a family of five. 

With this start-up loan, Zurab will purchase a truck and start a transportation service business.  He will carry and transport different things depending on the needs and requests of his customers in order to generate income. 

He hopes in the future to renovate the house and improve the living conditions for his family. Zurab would like to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a truck and start a transportation service business

loans.name: Mouhammad

texts.en:
Mouhammad is a hardworking youth client from Iraq. He is 22 years old, married and lives with his parents and his brother. Mouhammad and his parents provide the family income together.

Mouhammad is a baker and owns a bakery. He specializes in making various types of pastries and bread. He has a lot of experience in this field since he has worked at a bakery ever since he was ten years old. In 2004, after gaining much experience in this field, Mouhammad established his own business, and now he has two hired employees. He grew fast with fame and respect in his neighborhood and is well known by many as having an excellent reputation.

Mouhammad is requesting a youth loan of 1,800 USD. The aim of this loan is to renovate his bakery. Mouhammad believes that this renovation will attract more customers to his bakery and will result in an increase in his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, a 38-year-old married father of five from Thika, supports his family by operating a retail shop. His biggest challenge is insufficient income to keep the store well stocked. Because of this, he has been unable to attract more customers and expand the business. He needs to make his shop more profitable so he can improve living conditions for his family. 

He earns a monthly income of KES 8,000 which he uses to support his family. A loan from KADET LTD will allow Stephen to purchase washing detergents, cooking oil, salt and sugar for his store. With the additional income he will earn from the sale of these products, he plans to reinvest in the business. He wants to be able to continue to support the education of his five children through college. 

In the future, he hopes to expand his business to become a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Ayat

texts.en: Ayat, 21 years old, lives in Madaba-Jordan with her family which consists of five members. She is currently in her third year at the University, studying for her Bachelors degree. Ayat is planning to work in her  field of study in the future. Now facing a financial crisis, she is requesting a loan to pay for her study fees.

loans.use: To pay for her semester fees

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in the Kitale area of the North-rift region, a land known for maize production. He is married and has three children, all of whom are still of school-going age. He has practiced farming for 21 years. His primary sources of income are maize, poultry, eggs, and beans, which he sells at Namwela market. He also has a retail shop as an extra source of income.

He wants to expand his poultry farm by adding more poultry, which will result in more income through selling more poultry and more eggs. The income he gets from this project will enable him to pay school fees. The challenge he faces is poultry diseases. In five years, he wants to have improved on poultry-keeping and other agricultural activities.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Janneth

texts.es: La señora Janneth, es una persona humilde de 18 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a su cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo, actualmente la señora Janneth vive en la casa de sus padres, el domicilio está ubicado en la comunidad de Tíraque, la actividad principal  es la agrícola en ese sentido produce los siguientes productos agrícolas papa, haba, arveja y trigo; estos cultivos son producidos en los terrenos de sus padres sin costo alguno, para esta campaña de producción requiere capital de operación para poder comprar los insumos agrícolas como ser semilla de papa, abono orgánico y también piensa comprarse dos corderos, de tal forma en el futuro piensa poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos y por ende también mejorara la calidad de su vida de su dependiente.
texts.en: Janneth is a humble woman, 18 years old and unmarried, who finished elementary school. She has a young son as an economic dependent and currently lives in her parents' house. The house is in the village of Tíraque, in an agricultural region. She grows potatoes, beans, peas, and wheat on her parents' lands, which she is able to use at no cost. This growing season, she needs working capital to be able to buy agricultural supplies such as seed potatoes and organic fertilizer. She is also considering buying two lambs, which would help her increase her earnings and thereby improve her son's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies, seed potatoes, and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Jaklin

texts.es: Jaklin, de 30 años, es madre soltera de una niña de 5 años con quien vive en su casa propia. Jaklin se dedica a la venta de zapatos, sandalias, zapatillas y otros, tiene dos formas de venderlos, al contado o al crédito, el precio varia dependiendo al tiempo y la modalidad que desee el cliente. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 02 años y los realiza sola. Le gusta mucho su trabajo ya que le permite disponer de su tiempo según ella desee, además de poder mejorar sus ingresos a través de sus ventas, durante el tiempo que está haciendo su trabajo, aprendió mucho sobre sus clientes, es por eso que los trata muy bien y siempre les brinda una sonrisa, tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero lo que mas desea ahora es consolidar su negocio y en algún momento poder tener un local propio. Este es su quinto crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará mas calzados al por mayor, ya que desea empezar a ofrecer calzados para niños y caballeros.
texts.en:
Jaklin is a 30-year-old single mother and lives with her five-year-old daughter in her own home. Jaklin has for two years sold women's shoes, sandals, slippers, and other footwear. Her customers buy with cash or credit, paying prices that vary depending on the time of the sale and how the customer wants to pay. 

Jaklin runs the business herself, and enjoys her work as it allows her to set her own schedule. The business also allows Jaklin to increase her income through sales and she's learned a great deal about her customers. She always treats them kindly and serves them with a smile. Jaklin has many plans for the future, but her most immediate priority is to consolidate her business and at some point set up her own shop. 

This is Jaklin's fifth loan with Kiva. She's hopeful that the loan funds will allow her to implement her her plans, but she's also committed to making timely payments. Jaklin will purchase more wholesale footwear with the 800 soles that she's borrowing, as she'd like to begin offering men's and children's footwear.

loans.use: to purchase children's and men's footwear.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en casa sus familiares ubicada en el El Alto.
Ella cursó estudios sólo hasta secundaria, posteriormente hizo estudios de reposteria en un instituto, pero no pudo terminarlos porque no tenía recursos económicos suficientes, aún así, ellac cocina empanadas, rollos, tartas, pan, etc que vende al público 
Necesita crédito para compra de víveres o insumos, así podrá abastecerse
texts.en:
Fabiola is the single mother of a son and lives in a home with family members in El Alto. 

Fabiola only attended middle school, but then studied baking at an institute. She couldn't finish the baking program because she lacked the funds to pay for it, but she still makes a variety of baked goods that she sells to the public: empanadas [meat filled pastries], rolls, cakes, bread, and other items. Fabiola is applying for a loan to purchase supplies and ingredients so that she can maintain a sufficient inventory.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Soriana

texts.es:
Soriana vive en la ciudad de Imperial,  y junto a ella vive su hijo de 14 años de edad, al cual quiere muchísimo y por quien lucha cada día para poder ofrecerle una buena calidad de vida. Día a día  soriana trabaja en su pequeño negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, trabajo con el cual puede solventar los gastos del hogar con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio, es por ello que atiende a sus clientes con mucho cariño y amabilidad ya que de ello depende que pueda llevar ingresos a su hogar.

Soriana está muy agradecida con los prestamistas por el apoyo que le están brindando, ya que gracias a su gran ayuda Soriana podrá comprar telas, y materiales para la confección de prendas, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y seguirá luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder tener una empresa textil”
texts.en:
Soriana lives in the city of Imperial with her son, 14, whom she loves a lot.  Every day she strives to be able to give him a good quality of life.

Soriana works every day in her small business making clothing, a job with which she can pay the household expenses with great effort and sacrifice.  She serves her customers with a lot of affection and friendliness because she depends on them to be able to have an income for her household.

Soriana's very grateful to the lenders for the support they're giving her because thanks to their big help she'll be able to buy fabric and materials to make garments.  This way she'll be able to improve her income and she'll continue striving to make her biggest dream come true: "To give her son a profession and be able to have a textile business."

loans.use: to buy fabric and materials

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pottery business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Cynthia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her pottery business.

NWTF is re-listing Cynthia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children who are in school, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from loading pre-paid mobiles.  Gloria is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like beans, meat and spices for her restaurant business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her restaurant and pre-paid mobile loading business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as beans, meat and spices.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 59 years old and is widowed with six children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Letecia has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from raising pigs

Letecia is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher lives in the Nkubu area of the North-rift region. He is married and has six children, of whom one is still in school. Christopher has practiced farming for 33 years. His primary sources of income are milk, maize, beans and sugarcane, which he sells at Bondeni market.

He has requested for a loan of KES 52,000 to purchase a dairy cow. This cow will bring an increase in milk production.T he income generated will help him to pay school fees for his child. 

The challenge Christopher faces is diseases affecting both crops and livestock. In five years, he wants to have improved his farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his brother's secondary school tuition for the year.

loans.name: Tahani

texts.en:
Tahani is 25 years old. She lives in Mafraq, Jordan with her family which consists of eight members. Tahani has five brothers and sisters and she is the oldest. She works as a hairdresser. 

One of her sisters, who is 20 years old, is in her second year of studying for a Bachelor of Child Care, and is planning to expand her study to get her masters degree in the future after graduation. Tahani's family is facing financial crisis, so she is asking for a loan to be able to support her sister by paying for her study fees.

loans.use: to pay for her sister's semester fees.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and earns additional income from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her business.

Angela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing and fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosemarie has been in this business for 30 years now.

Rosemarie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her business.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, one of whom in school, Erlinda works hard to support her family. She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling rice.  

Erlinda is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase new varieties of rice seeds and other farm equipment for her rice farming business. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested a new loan to further build her business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new varieties of rice seeds and other farm equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 100 bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru:
Рахматулло обратился за вторым кредитом. Свой предыдущий кредит он брал для покупки пшеницы для изготовления муки. У него во дворе имеется мельница, на котором он производит муку на продажу. Он выражает всем благодарность за поддержку. 
Помимо своей основной деятельности Рахматулло имеет намерение заняться еще одним видом бизнеса. Он хотел бы заняться куплей и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Рахматулло имеет коровник, а также его стартовый капитал составляет 750 TJS. Он нуждается в кредите на сумму 2500 долларов США. Рахматулло собирается купить 5 голов коров и телят, а также 600 кг корма. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение 5 месяцев и уже к декабрю вывести скот на рынок на продажу. Кредит будет выплачивать за счет старой деятельности. Данный кредит позволит Рахматулло получать дополнительный доход и таким образом улучшить финансовое состояние его семьи.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo is applying for his second loan. He took out his previous loan to buy wheat for making flour. He has a mill in his yard where he produces flour for sale. He is grateful to all that supported him.

In addition to his core business, Rahmatullo intends to take up an additional business. He would like to go into business buying and selling cattle.  Rahmatullo has a barn and start-up capital of 750 TJS. He needs a loan of $2,500 USD. Rahmatullo intends to buy 5 cows and calves, as well as 600kg of feed. He plans to fatten the cattle for 5 months and put them up for sale in December. The loan will be paid back from his existing business. The loan would allow Rahmatullo to earn additional income and improve his family's financial situation.

loans.use: To buy 5 cows and calves, as well as 600kg of feed

loans.name: Sherlet

texts.en:
Sherlet is a married mother of two children. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and works hard to support her family.

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Sherlet has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is 50 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a business buying and selling charcoal and firewood in the Philippines. Victoria requested a PHP 18000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood to sell.

Victoria has been in this business for six years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 27 years old and has one child, who is not yet in school.  

Teddy is a businesswoman and runs a shop in town which deals in second hand clothing. She has been in this business for abou five years, and through this business she says she has achieved a lot, such as being able to feed her family, plus getting most of the basic necessities in her home.

She says that the biggest problem affecting her business is high operation costs such as rent, licences and transport costs to Kampala, where she does her shopping, and the returns are low.

Teddy says that she has acquired this loan in order to acquire more second hand clothes for selling in her shop. She also believes that with this loan facillty, her business will considerably expand in the future and she hopes to open numerous branches across the region. The location for Teddie’s business is in town and a lot has been achieved.

Finally, she thanks the lenders for providing loans to lower income earners at reduced interest rates.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for half of his nephew's secondary school tuition at Abaarso School of Science and Technology.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, two of whom in school, Jacqueline works hard to support her family.

She has a rice farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish.  Jacqueline is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business.

Jacqueline has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

Ruby successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Ruby's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and is married with seven children, four of whom in school.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Marcelina has been pig fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Marcelina is borrowing PHP 23000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is a 35-year-old businesswoman who deals in selling second hand shoes in mobile markets. She says she has been in this business for over ten years and through this business, she boasts to have paid school fees and acquired a plot of land in town.

She says she has acquired this loan in order to stock more shoes for her business and facilitate her while moving to markets. Safina also says the biggest challenge affecting her business is the lack of enough funds to keep her business moving plus bad debtors.

Safina is a mother of four children with only three children going to school. She says that she appreciates the work done by Ugafode in enabling the active poor access funding.

loans.use: to buy used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Tacianita

texts.en:
Tacianita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Tacianita requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
Rashida is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a restaurant business which has been involved in for six years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef ,rice, chicken and beans. She works at the market six days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

Rashida aspires of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, rice, chicken and beans.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 49 years old and is married with six children. With two children in school, Ruth works very hard to provide for them.

Ruth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, noodles, coffee, milk, soft-drinks, bath soap and other groceries. 

Ruth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 36 years old and is married with four children, two of whom in school.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a mobile general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and soap. She has been running her mobile general store for three years and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Prior to this loan, Gemma has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF. 

Gemma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, coffee, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Leah works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling bamboo.  Leah is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Esterlito

texts.es: Esterlito, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 48 años de edad, es casado y vive con su esposa y dos hijos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de frijoles , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener una buena cosecha, la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Esterlito, 48, is an enterprising man.  He's married and currently lives with his wife and two children.

He requested a loan to buy supplies such as soil amendments and fumigants.  He wants to take care of his bean crops to keep them in good condition while they grow so he'll get a good harvest.

Esterlito's only limitation is the lack of money to continue growing.  They count on this job to get ahead, which is why he's applying for a loan.

This is his first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to take care of his bean crop

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred lives in the Kitale area of the North Rift region. This land is known for its vast maize and sugarcane production. He is married and has six children, all of whom are school aged. He has practiced farming for ten years. His primary income is from tomatoes, beans, maize, and milk, which he sells at Chwele market. In addition to farming, he has a shop in Bungoma.

He wants to increase his production and therefore has requested a loan of 46,800 KES to finance his purchase of a dairy cow. This will lead to an increase in income, and as a result he will be able to pay for his children's school-fees.

In five years, Fred wishes to have grown to better level in terms of agricultural activities.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Qasim

texts.en:
Qasim is 27 years old, married, and has one child. Qasim owns a small shop where he sells plastic products. He established his business in 2005 and has gained good experience in this field. Qasim now has three employees hired.

Qasim is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to purchase plastic products and renovate his workplace. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide a good life for his family.

The story of Qasim and his business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for Economic Development clients who have been able to improve their businesses with a small business loan product, specifically designed to meet the needs of small businesses where a relatively small amount of capital can provide significant business improvement.

loans.use: to purchase new plastic products and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Esther's Group

texts.en:
The Esther’s Group is made up of 4 women who are very hardworking and tenacious. They work in different activities, such as vegetables, beans, soap, and noodles. All of the members are kind and gentle people who are business-oriented and are trying to get ahead. 

One of the members of this group is Esther, who is taking out her second loan. She is 52 years old and is a married mother of an 11-year-old boy who attends a local school. She does not own a home, so she lives in a rented dwelling.

Esther sells fresh garden eggs, pepper, okro, and tomatoes. She works from Mondays through Saturdays without a set schedule. She has had this business for 6 years, and it has been growing gradually. However, she lacks sufficient capital to buy her products.

She will use this loan to buy and sell fresh garden eggs, pepper, okro, and tomatoes. 

Esther’s dream is to have her own house. She is standing at the very right in the photograph.

The group needs a total amount of GHS 3500 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: to buy and sell fresh garden eggs, pepper, okro, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Nashkije

texts.en:
Nashkije lives in the southern part of Kosovo in an Ashkali Community. She is a mother of 8 children and her husband receives a pension from the government as his salary. As with all Ashkali community members, Nashkije and her family live in very poor and unacceptable conditions. Her house, which is very old and small, has not been repaired in the past several years and has some urgent needs. 

Nashkije is requesting a loan to buy door frames for the toilette and to renovate other areas of her house so that she can improve the living conditions of her family. She is very grateful for this opportunity to improve her living conditions and she appreciates all of the lenders!

loans.use: to buy door frames for the toilette and to renovate other areas of her house.

loans.name: Hamidah

texts.en:
Hamidah is married with six children. She also takes care of additional family members (grand children). 

She has a business selling maize and roasted bananas. She has been in this business for ten years, selling to all categories of people on both a wholesale and retail basis. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality, thieves and defaulters.

Hamidah has applied for a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more baskets of maize and bunches of bananas for roasting. 

She aspires of buying land so that she can start growing maize and also to build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees for grand children and rent.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas and baskets of maize.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 29-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been doing embroidery work with a machine at home for the past 3 years to support her family. Her husband is also doing the same work in a firm, but he earns an insufficient income to support his family alone. Therefore, he brings some embroidery work home for her. She helps her husband in his work and also sells knitted embroidery in her town. At this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She is a mother of 2 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to purchase a machine for embroidery. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

Shumaila is very thankful to the Kiva and the BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase pearls, a variety of threads, needles and precious stones for embroidery.

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nareman is 34 years old and is from Ramallah. She is married and lives with her husband and three children who attend the primary school.

Nareman has owned a beauty salon since 2012 and has one employee who helps her. She asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy hair dryers and hair washing chairs, and to decorate her salon.

She believes that this loan will make her salon attractive to costumers, and this will help her family financially.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers and hair washing chairs, and to decorate her salon.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is widowed with four children, and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (nephews). 

She has a charcoal-selling business and has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through operating a kiosk and selling piped water. She works from home seven days per week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from the villages to her home and also the rainy season, which hinders her movements. She dreams of owning a delivery van to make transportation easier, to become a wholesaler, and also to build rental rooms. 

She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is 52 years old and is married with six children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Cecelia has been in the poultry business for 2 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
Soledad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Soledad requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like rice, snack foods, cream, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 4 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: purchase more stock like rice, snack foods, cream, soft-drinks, cooking oil, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy materials for her business.

Delia has been in this business for 4 years. She earns additional income from fishing.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Eriolita

texts.en:
Eriolita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Eriolita has been in this business for 8 years. Eriolita earns additional income from buying and selling fish and as a fish pond operator.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Eriolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Mt Meru Group

texts.en:
Sabina, who is in her late 20s, is single.  She has been running a clothing sales business, selling fabric and sarongs, for three years now.  She works from 9.00am to 7.00pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Sabina's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy more fabric and sarongs.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She saved the profit she got at the bank.  She will use this loan to buy more fabric and sarongs to resell.  She dreams of expanding her business by opening a big shop where she can even sell rolls of materials.

Sabina will share this loan with her loan group "Mt Meru" with eleven members.  The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Amalia works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently through Kiva. She is now requesting a loan of PHP 30000 to buy more groceries to sell.

Amalia hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, four of whom are in school, Lorna works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns an additional income from selling vegetables. Lorna is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 54 years old and lives in the village of Krasnoe with his 25-year-old daughter. The source of income for the family is a small scale agricultural business. In particular, milking cow whose milk is sold locally. Besides this, Iuri cultivates a plot of land and sows various of vegetables, which are used for feeding.

As the existing income is not enough for food and every day expenses, Iuri decided to purchase a car and start a taxi business. However, he would have to charge higher prices for his service because the price of benzene is high. Not many citizens could afford to use the taxi service at a higher price. Because of the above mentioned problem, Iuri will change his car's fuel system from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation by 40 to 45 percent. It will allow Iuri to offer cheaper service to his customers. With this startup loan, Iuri will buy a second-hand car and pay a local auto service center to change the fuel system. He will start his taxi business and help the family in covering food and everyday expenses. The increased income will be used for the family's well being.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand car and change its fuel system.

loans.name: Ebion Group

texts.en:
“I raise cattle,” says Nengthem, and smiles away. Women usually don’t raise cattle. If they do, they also assist their husbands, but Nengthem raises cattle and is also involved in ginger farming. 

Nengthem is the featured borrower member for Ebion Group. She is pictured with her hand raised on the extreme left in the picture. The village where she and the other group members reside is about 45 kms away from the capital town, and it is a hilly region. Her husband is a builder, and he builds wooden houses and fixes wooden doors, windows, etc. His earning is unreliable, as it is entirely based on availability of work. The meagre income of the family is supplemented by Nengthem as well, by selling ginger and raising livestock.

Nengthem grows ginger on the hill slopes near the village. She also grows other vegetables, but her main produce is ginger. She also sells livestock in the village and nearby villages. The livestock are taken to the ginger fields in the morning, and they graze on the fields. They are brought back home in the evening when they are coming back from work. 

Since the lamb’s main feed is grass, it is easier to raise them, as there is no extra expense on livestock feed. She can manage both the activities without much effort, and she also helps generate more income with selling ginger and livestock. With the present income, she could not afford to purchase more lambs, as the income is used for household expenses and other expenses. 

Nengthem wants a loan to purchase three or more lambs. She will rear them in her field, and she can also work on her ginger farming without any disturbances. Once they are fully grown, then she can sell them. 

She usually sells the ginger to the women vendors in the town market, as well to the vendors in the main market. She is glad that Kiva and WSDS are cooperating to develop the underserved women; she is trying to generate income for the family and herself to make a stand in the society.

She thanked Kiva and WSDS once again.

loans.use: to purchase three or more lambs, rear them, and sell them for profit when fully grown.

loans.name: Damalie

texts.en: Damalie is a single mother of five children and four of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling secondhand clothes and has been in this clothing business for seven years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through selling fish and from rental rooms. She works in a shop and sells at the retail shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and thieves. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah is married with four children and all her children go to school. She has a retail shop. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap. She does not have any other income-generating activity. She works five days a week and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include transportation, defaulters and the ever increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. She aspires to sell wholesale and also to educate her children up to the university level. She resides in her own house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Lucila works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lucila is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business farming rice.

Lucila has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 51 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell. Rita has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as bread, sardines, sugar, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Al Fawar Group

texts.en:
Zenaida is the featured borrower of Al Fawar group. She joined with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua. They have been friends since they came to work in Lebanon from their hometowns in the Philippines. 

Zenaida is the 48-year-old divorced mother of five children. She works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved children with a good living. The loan she has applied for will be sent to her children in the Philippines to pay for their necessary school needs. She is the second from the right in the picture. As for the other group members, Leonora is the first from the right, Josefina is the tallest (she's the second from the left), and finally Lourdes is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees.

loans.name: Pritse

texts.en: Pritse works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, milk and coffee, to sell in her general store. Pritse has been in this business for 10 years now. In the future, Pritse would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries like canned goods, soft drinks, juice, milk and coffee, to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Hanadi

texts.en: Hanadi is 20 years old. She lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with her family which consists of 10 members. Hanadi is currently studying her Bachelor of Business Administration in the 1st year. She is planning to work in the field of her studies after graduation. As she is facing financial problems, she is requesting a loan to pay for her student fees.

loans.use: to pay for her fees.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen, age 49, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband manufactures plastic bottles and sells them in the main market. This is a profitable business for him. This business is the only source of income for the family.

Parveen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase raw material to manufacture plastic bottles to sell. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Parveen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to manufacture plastic bottles.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 28-year-old married woman from Lahore, Pakistan. She lives in a tiny house with her husband and four children. 

Her husband had been doing job in a clothing firm with low income, which was not enough to cover the family's needs, so he opened a small restaurant in the city three years ago. It is a good business and earns enough money for his family, but he would like to improve it by expanding the space and buying more tables, chairs and cooking oil. 

Nasreen took a loan from BRAC Pakistan to accomplish the improvements. Using this loan, her husband will be able to develop his business so his income will be increased.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil and plastic furniture for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Noe Marcelino

texts.es: Noé de 32 años de edad vive con sus hermanos y sus padres en casa de ellos pero no posee luz eléctrica, el se dedica a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz y el maicillo sus hermanos le ayudan en la cosecha con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda a solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Noé está solicitando un crédito para la compra de una lámpara solar ya que en la comunidad donde el reside nadie posee luz eléctrica y con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo, la lámpara es una estación de carga con energía de paneles solares en forma de lámpara que sirve para los hogares de zonas rurales donde no poseen energía eléctrica, con esta compra se podrán beneficiar con su familia ya que por las noches podrán tener luz propia.
texts.en:
Noé is 32 years old and lives with his siblings and parents in their own home, but it does not receive electricity. He is a farmer whose main crops are corn and sorghum. His siblings help with the harvest and the profits that are generated from the sales are used to pay for some of the household expenses.

Noé is requesting a loan in order to buy a solar lamp since nobody in his community has electricity or earns enough to have it installed. The lamp is also a charging station that is powered by the energy from solar panels. This type of lamp is useful for homes in rural areas that don’t have electricity. This purchase will benefit his family since they will be able to have light at night.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: 10 Estrellas Del Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 ESTRELLAS DEL NORTE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: panadería, elaboración de queques, hilado de lana de vicuña, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de hilado de vicuña; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió de su hermana, empezando con un poco capital y en la actualidad creció ampliamente con el crédito obtenido.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de fibra de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales, por mayor, y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, el crédito y las reuniones.
texts.en:
The “10 Estrellas Del Norte” communal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Alto Lima Centro Focal.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors.  Lidia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied and include a bakery, making cakes, spinning vicuña wool, neighborhood store, and selling vegetables.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen where Lidia is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who went to visit her.  She currently has a business spinning vicuña wool.  She relates that she took over this business from her sister, starting with a small amount of capital.  It has now grown a great deal with the loan that she got.

The loan that she will now take out is to buy vicuña fiber that she will get wholesale at the traditional fairs.  After production she will sell at her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family.  She is single and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the saving, the loans, and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy vicuña fiber.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

She earns additional income from farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 45 years old and married with seven children. With two children currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 22000 PHP (Philippine peso) loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, soy sauce, milk, detergent soap, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Juliter

texts.en:
Juliter appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva, which enabled her to earn more profits that she used to improve her living standards.
She is requesting a loan of 70,000 KES to purchase sacks of potatoes, fruits and vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es: La señora Fidelia, es una persona de 46 años de edad, de estado civil viuda, alcanzo estudiar hasta la primaria, vive en su propia casa con su  pequeño nieto, su domicilio se encuentra en la comunidad de Tiraque. La actividad principal a la que se dedica es la agricultura, produce  Papa 56 cargas, Haba (verde)  30 arrobas, Arveja (arveja) 20 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos los realiza en sus terrenos propios heredados de su padre que están ubicados en la misma localidad, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, y los quesos que hace la señora Fidelia  los vende a una panadería, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, el préstamo que solicita es para capital de inversión, es para compra de terreno agrícola, de esa forma con la ampliación del terreno tendrá una mejor producción y mejoraran sus ingresos económicos; por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Fidelia is a person who is 46 years old and a widow. She was able to go to school up to the primary level. She lives in her own house with her little grandchild. Her home is located in the community of Tiraque. The main activity to which she dedicates herself is agriculture. She produces potatoes (56 loads), green beans (30 arrobas), and peas (20 loads). She plants these crops on her own lands, which she inherited from her father. The land is located in the same area where she lives. She carries out the agricultural work in collaboration with her neighbors. Fidelia also makes cheese, which she sells to a bakery. She lives in a rustic house made of adobe. The loan she is requesting is for investment capital, in order to buy agricultural land. In this way, by expanding her land, she will have better production and will increase her income and thus the quality of life of her dependents.

loans.use: to buy agricultural land.

loans.name: Saad

texts.en: Saad is 29 years old. He is single and lives in Mafraq, Jordan, with his six brothers and sisters. Saad is the oldest between them. He is currently studying for a Bachelor of Accounting degree, in his second year. Saad is planning to continue his studies to get a higher degree after his graduation. As he is facing a financial crisis, he needs a loan to be able to pay for his study fees.

loans.use: to pay for his study fees.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with two children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. 

Justine works at the market six days out of every week and sells to all categories of people, but on a retail basis. She generates additional income through poultry farming. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to build her own house. She resides in  a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: Diego, un hombre emprendedor , tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres y hermanos actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de frijoles , con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener una buena cosecha, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Diego is an enterprising man.  He is 20 years old and single.  He currently lives with his parents and siblings.  He requested a loan because he wants to buy supplies like fertilizers and fumigants.  He wishes to care for his bean crops.  He wants to do this in order to keep them in good condition while they grow in order to get a good harvest.  

This is because they depend upon this business activity in order to be able to get ahead.  That is why he is making the request for a loan.  This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He does not have other loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en:
Shahlo is 41 years old. She and her husband are poor and have three children. She is very hardworking and kind-natured. Shahlo has a lot of friends and all of them love her very much.
Shahlo has been farming for 25 years, producing nuts. She has been in this line of work since she was a girl, so all of her experience has been dedicated to producing nuts. Her products are sold at the local market in the city. She has a small income from this business.
In order to improve living conditions her son wants to go to Russia and find a good job. In this way he wants to find a new source of income. She has no money to buy an airfare ticket for her son. She is asking for a loan of 2500 TJS (Tajikistani somoni). She awaits your support and thanks you in advance for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy an airplane ticket for her son who is going to Russia to find a job

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of six children and two of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents and grandchildren). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She generates additional income through selling piped water. 

Margaret works from home and sells six days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to sell on wholesale only and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 43 years old and married with five children. With five children currently in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

Lilibeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 21,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Lilibeth has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items, such as laundry soap, noodles, cooking oil, bread, coffee, sugar, etc. 

Lilibeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to boost her business by buying animal feeds and more stock, including poultry

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 58 years old and married with ten children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Delia is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Delia has been farming rice for three years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ismet

texts.en:
Ismet is a 49 year old, married, father of three children. Together, they all live in a Roma community in Kosovo. He works as a guard in a prison and his wife is a house wife and stay at home mom, taking care of the house and the children. Having three children he finds it difficult to be able to serve them food and pay for their education. In order to earn more for his living expenses he is planning to start his own business. 
His business plan is to keep sheep so that he can raise them, sell the milk and other dairy products and even sell some of the newborn sheep that will be born. He is requesting a loan to be able to buy 20 sheep in order to begin his venture. The money that this loan will generate after he invests it will help him to improve the living conditions for his entire family. He is a very responsible and hard working and hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his farm even more. He is very grateful to all the lenders for their support!

loans.use: To buy 20 sheep

loans.name: Alis' Group

texts.en:
Alis is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five daughters and one son. She began knitting handmade embroidery at her home six years ago. Four of her daughters also help her in the completion of her tasks. Her husband is a painter and provides white wash services, but with irregularity: he is an irresponsible person and does not care for the welfare of his children. Alis has to prove herself a responsible and brave mother. In the past six years she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Alis requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She does not want lose her heart and wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family.

Alis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

loans.name: Tamazi

texts.en:
Tamazi is 27 years old. He lives in the Bolnisi district of Georgia with his children, wife and parents. His previous Kiva loan was a great support, as he managed to cultivate a plot of land and grow a good quality harvest.

With this loan, Tamazi would like to purchase a tractor. He will use it to perform agricultural work on the lands of nearby farmers, mainly in tilling and sowing seasons, and will be paid by landlords. He will save any profits generated by the tractor and continue to cultivate his own land. 

He expects that this loan will significantly increase his family's income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Roin

texts.en:
Roin, age 25, is a security guard from the village of Kobuleti, Adjara Region. He is married and lives with his wife, two sons, and parents. Roin has vocational education in stomatology, but he doesn’t work in his profession.

Roin’s father works as a security guard as well and gets small monthly salary, but at the same time he leads an agricultural business. The family owns a citrus garden and a plot of land where maize and nuts are grown. The harvested products are sold locally.

Roin is a very enthusiastic young man and wishes to provide his family with enough income. He owns a car and plans to use it in trading. With the received credit Roin will purchase a coffee grinder and make coffee deliveries to the local grocery stores. He will also change the fuel system in his car from benzene to gas, which is cheaper than benzene and will reduce the cost of transportation.

The new business initiative, financed with a Startup loan, will generate good income for the family, and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a coffee grinder and change his car's fuel system

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 35, is from the village of Chuneshi in Georgia. He lives with his wife, two children and retired mother as well as an aunt.

The family runs an agricultural business, breeding pigs and selling piglets at the local open market. They run a dairy farm as well and sell cheese to retailers. In addition, George owns a vineyard and a nut garden. The harvested grapes are used to produce wine for selling. 

Besides his agricultural activities, George works at a printing house to earn a monthly income. All the family members work hard, but their existing income is not enough for a family their size.

George has requested this loan to purchase a van, which he will use in the trading business. He will purchase fruits and vegetables from nearby villages and sell them at a price mark-up in another district. He will renew his assortment every morning and offer fresh products to his customers. 

This new business initiative, financed by Kiva lenders, will significantly increase the family’s monthly income and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a van to use in the trading business

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 26-year-old married man. He has a child who is two years old. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport service business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area favorable for business. He describes his biggest challenge as the lack of funds to boost the business. 

He will use the 20,000 KES loan to boost business by buying motorcycle spare parts and fuel. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a taxi, which will earn him higher returns and improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM, and he will use the anticipated profits to buy a taxi. His business goal is to buy a piece of land and put up residential homes within five years.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and animal feeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from seven to sixteen years. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a restaurant where she cooks food to sell and also sells cereals and drinks. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Mary's business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge as increases in prices. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to expand business by buying maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, cereals and other items for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a large and attractive business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, cooking oil, wheat flour, cereals and other items

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of two children, and both of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business making and selling liquid soap. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more chemicals for making soap. She has been in this business for two years. She generates additional income through selling bunches of Irish potatoes. 

Esther works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to own a bigger factory for making liquid soap and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more chemicals for making liquid soap

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is a 28-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as determined. He owns rental houses which he rents to tenants; he also keeps cows for milk. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area favorable for business and his primary customers are local residents. 

Denis describes his biggest business challenge as the lack of money to expand. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy iron sheets, timber, nails and other items to repair and build more rental houses. He will also buy animal feeds. His business goal is to build good rental houses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will become a wholesale farmer. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets, timber, nails and other items to repair and build more rental houses and also to buy animal feeds

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 38-year-old single woman. She has one child. She describes herself as determined. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, watermelons, pineapples, and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area favorable for business, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Margaret describes her biggest business challenge as the lack of enough money to boost the business. She will use the KES 70,000 loan to add stock of watermelons, bananas, pineapples and other items for resale. Her business goal is to grow within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of watermelons, bananas, pineapples and other items for resale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 36 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. Four of them are currently in school. For the past three years, Catherine has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as beer and soda. 

To help expand her business, Catherine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more beers and sodas to sell, which will help Catherine to generate greater profits to pay school fees for her children and support other family needs. Catherine hopes that in the future she will be able to live a good life. 

Catherine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Catherine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more beers and sodas to sell

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, aged 47, is a married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rachel has had a general store business in the Philippines for the past seven years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, soft drinks, laundry soap, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store.

In the future, Rachel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, soft drinks, laundry soap, noodles, eggs, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a very hard-working woman who lives in Voi. She sells clothes to passersby and market dwellers. Her greatest challenge is seasonality.

Rose is requesting a loan of Ksh. 50,000 to purchase bales of clothes. She joined Yehu to access financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is married with three children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more   clothes like shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts and sweaters.  

Justine moves door to door selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people. She sells on a retail basis and works six days out of every week.  Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. 

Justine aspires to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and electric bills.

loans.use: To buy more clothes like shirts, blouses, trousers, skirts and sweaters.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a Kiva borrower who describes himself as persistent. He operates a shoe retail store where he sells second-hand shoes. Moses has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are men. He describes his biggest business challenge as the unavailability of stock.
