She mainly sells butter, sugar, tea, pasta, eggs, biscuits, wafers, chocolate, candy, refreshments and so on. Her goods are constantly in demand and quickly sell out. Her children help her with the business. 

Currently Zilyat would like to increase the assortment of products and expand her business. With this intention she applied for a loan. Zilyat would like to save the income from the business and in the future renovate her house and marry away her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase food products for her store, to develop her business

loans.name: Suhrobi

texts.ru: Сухроб молодой активный житель столицы - города Душанбе. Ему 25 лет. Он холост, живет с матерью. Сухроб имеет среднее техническое образование. Он хочет начать собственный бизнес. Сухроб накопил сбережение и теперь обратился за кредитом, чтобы купить микроавтобус марки Hyundai Starex. Он планирует работать по маршрутной линии города и в день делать 5 кругов. Сухроб будет работать с восьми утра до пяти часов вечера. Это прибыльный бизнес, так как в центре города всегда многолюдно и данная услуга очень востребована. Данный кредит позволит Сухробу иметь собственный бизнес, за счет которого он сможет накопить деньги на свою свадьбу. Он будет благодарен за любую помощь.
texts.en:
Suhrobi is a young and active resident of the city of Dushanbe. He is 25 years old. He is single and lives with his family. Suhrobi has technical secondary education. He would like to start his own business. 

Suhrobi saved up money and currently applied for a loan in order to purchase a minibus of the type Hyundai Starex. He plans to work on the "marshrutka" line of the city and do five rounds per day. Suhrobi will work from the morning to five in the afternoon. This is a profitable business, as there is always a lot of people in the center of the city, and this service is in high demand. 

This loan will allow Suhrobi to have his own business, from which he may save up money for his wedding. He is thankful for any help.

loans.use: to purchase a Hyundai Starex minibus for starting a business

loans.name: Cholpon

texts.ru: Чолпон 36 лет, незамужем, имеет 2 детей (1 сын и 1 дочь). Чолпон развелась с мужем после рождения детей. Соседи ее характеризуют как аккуратную, требовательную и ответственную женщину. У нее среднее образование, в поисках доходов для своей небольшой семьи, Чолпон с 1983 года занимается частным предпринимательством. Арендует небольшое кафе с бильярдной. Стартовала этот бизнес с 10,000 сом KGS.  Благодаря упорному труду Чолпон, она смогла развить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Чолпон расширить свой бизнес и привлечь много клиентов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чолпон обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку товаров для кафе и бильярдной. Доходы от кредита помогут Чолпон развить ее бизнес, а также полученная прибыль поможет приготовить приданое для дочери на свадьбу.
texts.en:
Cholpon is 36 years old, not married, and has two children (one son and one daughter). Cholpon divorced from her husband after the birth of the children. Her neighbors describe her as an accurate, demanding and responsible woman. She has secondary education. 

In search of income for her small family, Cholpon has worked in private business since 1983. She rents a small cafe with a pool table. She started this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Cholpon's persistent work, she was able to develop her business. It brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month, which serves as the basis for covering food and household expenses for the family. The income from the business allowed Cholpon to expand her business and attract many customers. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Cholpon turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of products for her cafe. The income from the loan helps Cholpon develop her business, and also the income received helps prepare a dowry for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Sol Y Luna Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL Y LUNA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Clorinda ella es soltera y tiene 60 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, ella vende en el mercado, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno, arroz con pollo y sopas, la socia prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollo, carne y verduras para el restaurant.


Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de taxi, negocio de fotocopiadora, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Sol y Luna Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district of the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

Clorinda, 60, is single and has three children.  She works in her business selling food in the market.  She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, chicken and rice, and soups.  She makes breakfast, lunch, and dinner, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She has had the business for eight years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Clorinda's requesting the loan to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables for the restaurant.

The businesses of the other members are a taxi service, photocopying, a grocery store, and food sales.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and promises to make her payments by the deadline.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a 45-year-old woman who is married with three children. She makes and sells elei printed materials to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. Salome is asking for a loan to help her pay for her children's school fees. She will also use part of the loan to buy material, stencils, brushes, paint and wooden carved designs. Salome joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, stencils, brushes, paint, wooden carved designs and pay school fees

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en:
Marusya is 64 years old. She lives in Spitak city in the Lori region. Marusya is married and she has two sons and a daughter, all of whom are married. Her sons and their families lost their houses, which were destroyed as the result of a very severe earthquake several years ago, and now they live in the Russian Federation. Marusya lives with her retired husband. It has already been seven years since she engaged in the trading business. She sells carpets, bedding, tablecloths, towels, etc. in her rented shop. She buys the needed products from Yerevan wholesale markets once a month.
Marusya asks for a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams as she plans to buy a lot of various kinds of bedding and she also wants to start trading in children's clothes.

loans.use: to buy a lot of various kinds of bedding and start trading in children's clothes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 45  años de edad, está casado con Nelith quien es comerciante y madre de sus 2 hijas. Vive en compañía de su esposo, sus hijas y su nieta a quienes quiere mucho, juntos habitan cómodamente su casa propia. Juan se dedica a la compra y venta de madera. Para cumplir con su labor tiene un espacio alquilado dentro de un establecimiento maderero en donde atiende a sus clientes, además de ello también transforma la madera en piezas de parquet los cuales vende a mayores precios. Trabaja solo desde hace 20 años y esta muy contento por que le permite tener buenas ganancias económicas. Al principio era muy complicado para él realizar este trabajo ya que es muy complicado debido a la intensa competitividad que existe en este rubro, sin embargo gracias al paso del tiempo ha adquirido la experiencia necesaria para consolidar su clientela. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/.3000 soles y agradece a todas las personas que le brindan la oportunidad de acceder al financiamiento que requiere para que continúe trabajando. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará madera para venderlas y otra parte de la materia prima lo usará para la fabricación de parquet.
texts.en:
Juan is 45 years old and is married to Nelith, who is a merchant. They have two daughters. Juan lives with his wife, daughters and granddaughter, who he loves very much. Together they live comfortably in their own home. Juan works buying and selling lumber. His business is located in a space he rents inside a lumberyard. Here he waits on his customers and converts lumber into pieces of parquet that he then sells at higher prices. He has worked at this business by himself for 20 years and is very happy with it because it provides him with a good income. He says that at first it was very difficult for him to do this work because of the intense competition that exists in this area. However, with the passage of time he says he has acquired the experience necessary to establish a customer base.

Juan is requesting 3000 PEN to buy lumber at wholesale prices. He will sell some of the lumber, and the other part he will use to make parquet. He says that he is grateful to everyone that has brought him this opportunity to access the financing he needs to continue working, and that he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to buy lumber at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
This is Florife. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife hopes to have more good customers and dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics

loans.name: Ashot

texts.en: Ashot lives in the village of Azatamut in the Tavush region. He is married and he has a son and a daughter. His wife used to work at the notary office, but now she is on maternity leave and takes care of their children. Ashot works at the woodworking workshop as a sawyer and at the same time he perfectly manages farming. He is raising a cow, two heifers and three piglets. He manages to sell milk, macun (Armenian national dairy product) and meat right from his house. The income is not very big, but Ashot thinks that if he manages to enlarge his farm cattle the profit will be much more. That is why he is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months.

loans.use: to buy two calves and a lot of animal fodder for the winter months

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es: Evelyn, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa. Está divorciada del padre de su hija.  Vive en compañía de su hija, sus padres y su hermano en la casa de sus padres. Evelyn se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores de diversos modelos, tallas y colores para damas, caballeros y niños. Realiza las ventas de manera personalizada entre sus amigos y familiares. Toda la mercadería que pone a la venta es seleccionada por ella misma. Lleva en este negocio más de 2 años. Le gusta su actividad pues gracias a ella puede generar el dinero que necesita o para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos familiares, además su actividad hace que se sienta una mujer  ocupada y productiva. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado comprará más prendas íntimas para que siga realizando su labor.
texts.en:
Evelyn, 23, is a hard-working and diligent woman. She is divorced from the father of her daughter. She lives with her daughter, her parents, and her brother in her parent’s house. 

Evelyn sells various types, sizes, and colors of undergarments for women, men, and children. She offers this personalized service to her friends and relatives. All the merchandise that she sells is selected by her. She has been in this business for more than two years. She likes this job because thanks to it, she can make the money that she needs or she can help support her parents with the family expenses. Her job also makes her feel like a busy and productive woman.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support because this way she will feel secure in moving forward with her business. Furthermore, she promises once again to make her installment payments on time. With the amount requested, she will buy more intimate garments so she can continue working.

loans.use: to buy undergarments.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia appreciates the previous loan with Kiva that enabled her to make profits to educate her children and improve their living standards.

She is requesting a loan of KES 40,000 to purchase a water tank for more resale. She joined Yehu to access more funds.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank for more resale

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo para mantener el negocio y sus ingresos; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la mercadería necesaria para la comida, tales como: carnes, pollo, arroz, frijol, azúcar, verduras, entre otros.
Cuenta la Sra. Paula que gracias al crédito anterior el negocio ha tenido buenos resultados, ya que los ingresos han incrementado. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Paula has been presented with the need to request a new loan to maintain her business and her income.  This investment will help her to purchase the necessary merchandise for her food, such as meat, chicken, rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

Paula says that thanks to the last loan, her business has had good results since her profits have increased.  The financial condition of her family has improved.

loans.use: to purchase meat, chicken, rice, beans, sugar, vegetables, and other items.

loans.name: Raffiqan

texts.en:
Raffiqan is a housewife. She is asking for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC for her husband's work. He manufactures chains and sells them in the market to fulfill household needs. His net income is not enough to save some amount for future needs. He is providing even basic needs to their family with so many hurdles and challenges. 

He needs some amount to purchase iron coils to make chains. Therefore his wife has requested a loan so that she can help him in purchasing the needed things. This is very important for him to continue his work. She hopes that the loan will be good for her husband's work. She promises to pay back the loan amount on time. She says hello to all Kiva lenders and asks them to pray for her children's bright future.

loans.use: to purchase iron coils to make chains

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda, de 64 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Arminda se dedica a alquilar habitaciones, los cuales ha habilitado en todo su terreno. Inicialmente tenía 4 habitaciones pero con el paso del tiempo ha logrado instalar 10 en total. Empezó con este trabajo hace 7 años. Trabaja con ayuda de su esposo quien se encarga de las reparaciones cuando son necesarias mientras que ella se encarga del acondicionamiento y la limpieza de las habitaciones. Por fortuna le va muy bien en este rubro económico. Adicionalmente vende prendas de vestir de manera eventual. Le gusta su negocio ya que no le ocupa mucho tiempo y tiene un ingreso constante de dinero, además puede ocupar su tiempo libre en otras actividades. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, está muy emocionada al saber que hay personas que le brindan un respaldo económico para continuar desarrollando su actividad laboral, así mismo se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de maderas, clavos, mallas metálicas y listones para terminar de habilitar 2 habitaciones más.
texts.en:
Arminda is 64 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their four children in the house they own.  Arminda works renting homes, which have been built on her land.  She originally had four houses but with the passage of time she has been able to build 10 in total.  She started with this work seven years ago.  She works together with her husband, who is in charge of repairs when they are needed, while she takes care of the set up and cleaning of the houses.  Thankfully, they have done very well with this business.  She also sells clothing on a part-time basis.  She likes this business since it does not take up much time and has a constant flow of income.  Additionally, she can use her free time for other activities.

At this time, she is requesting 1,000 soles.  She is very excited to know that there are people who can provide financial help to continue developing her business.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of wood, nails, metal netting, and slats to finish building two more houses.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, metal netting, and slats to build two rental houses.

loans.name: Elva Amparo

texts.es:
Doña Elva es una mujer de 42 años de edad luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superarse y de salir adelante, casada y madre de 2 los cuales viven bajo su mismo techo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el tercer grado. Con una gran experiencia sobre el mantenimiento, limpieza, abono y corte de café ella lucha diariamente para salir adelante en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos ya que esta actividad es su único medio de ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia. Dicha actividad (siembra y cultivo de café) fue inculcada por sus padres desde su juventud y lo práctica hace más de 20 años y hoy en día de forma propia. 

Actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café esto para que sea una cosecha sana y provechosa para poder generar ingresos, obtener ganancias y poder seguir invirtiendo en la misma.

Sus metas a corto plazo es poder ahorrar un capital propio y libre para trabajar de manera propia ampliando sus cultivos y entregándose más para de esa forma trabajar y fortalecer el patrimonio familiar que será heredado por sus hijos mismos que en la actualidad se involucran en las actividades del campo.
texts.en:
Elva, age 42, is a tenacious and enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed and get ahead.  She is married and has two children who live under her roof.  She attended primary school up until the third grade.

Together with her husband and their children, and with great experience in maintenance, clearing the fields, fertilizing, and cutting coffee, she struggles every day in order to get ahead.  This business activity is her only source of income to support her family.  Planting and cultivating coffee was instilled in her by her parents when she was young.  She has been doing this for over 20 years, and she now does it in her own way.

She is currently requesting help to buy fertilizer and manure to provide maintenance on her coffee crops.  She will do this so that the harvest will be healthy and profitable, to be able to generate income, to get earnings, and to be able to continue investing in the crops.

Her short term goals are to be able to save her own capital and to have it available to work in her own way, expanding her crops, and giving more of herself to this way of working.  She wants to strengthen the family legacy, which her own children will inherit.  They are now involved in the farming activities.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 39-year-old married mother of two. She has worked as a social worker for 17 years. Her low income and her husband's combined together aren't enough to cover their family's increasing needs.

Rania is acquiring her third loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to pay for her children's annual school fees. This loan is very important to her, since she can't save this amount from her monthly income, because of her family's increasing needs and requests.

Her previous loans were also invested in covering such needs, and she was a good borrower. She hopes to develop in her domain to achieve new goals in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her children's annual tuition fees

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Elena is 59 years old and lives in the village of Goght in the Kotayk region. Elena lives with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandson. Her son has a food business; her daughter-in-law takes care of their child. 

Elena is a very nice and cheerful lady who perfectly manages farming and agriculture with her family. She is a Jack of all trades. The number of cattle on her farm is very large, but she is never tired. She has cows, calves, bulls, piglets, sheep, lambs, goats, kids, and chickens, which give her a great range of farm products to sell: milk, cheese, sour cream, macun (Armenian national dairy product), meat, wool, and eggs. She also has a large vegetable and fruit garden (cucumbers, tomatoes, greens, beans, onions, apples, peaches, plums, grapes, etc.).

With such a large number of cattle, Elena has a serious problem feeding them during the winter. She has decided to buy a large shipment of animal fodder, and she asks for a loan of 1.000.000 Armenian drams for that.

loans.use: to buy a large shipment of animal fodder to feed her cattle during the winter.

loans.name: Floriana

texts.en:
Floriana appreciates the previous loan she got from Kiva that helped her get profits from her tailoring business, thus improving her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase fabric, thread, materials and buttons for her business. She joined Yehu to access the loan funds.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, materials and buttons for her business

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is 26 years old and lives with her family in Vanadzor. She graduated from Vanadzor Medical College and is a nurse. Liana is married and has a daughter. Her husband is a military serviceman. Now she works at the garrison hospital, in the department of infection, as a nurse. 

Liana has a problem connected with teeth; she needs a course of treatment that is very expensive, and she needs some money now.

Both Liana’s and her husband's salaries hardly cover their family needs and only with a loan can Liana solve her problem. She asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to start her treatment.

loans.use: to solve her dental problems

loans.name: Reyna Esperanza

texts.es:
Reyna es una joven de 29 años de edad en un estado civil en unión libre y madre de 1 hijo el cual vive y depende de ellos. Ella cuenta con un grado de educación primario completo que pudo cursar gracias al apoyo de sus padres. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a cultivar maíz, frijoles y café. Actualmente ella se dedica al cultivo de café en compañía de su pareja la cual es su único apoyo en un terreno que es propio gracias a los ahorros y a DIOS el cual está ubicado en la misma propiedad donde ellos habitan por lo que el mantenimiento a sus cultivos es más fácil incluso su asistencia técnica. 

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL pata la compra de abono, formula cafetalera, fertilizantes, foliares entre otros para dar asistencia y protección a sus cultivos de café con los cuales planea sacar una buena cosecha y un grano atractivo para sus clientes.

Sus planes son mejorar y abonar la tierra que ellos cultivan para que sus cultivos de café mantengan el follaje y el grano sano ya que de esta forma ellos podrán contar con una cosecha segura. Su sueño es como el de toda madre apoyar a su hijo en sus estudios y lograr enviarlo a la universidad para que él pueda graduarse de una carrera universitaria y que no pase por la misma situación que ellos en su juventud.
texts.en:
Reyna is a 29 year old young woman in a common law marriage.  She has one son, who lives with and depends on them.  She has an elementary school education and was able to complete it thanks to her parents’ support.  It was they who taught her to raise corn, beans, and coffee.  She currently raises coffee with her partner who is her only source of support, on a piece of farmland she owns, located where she lives, thanks to her savings and God’s help, and she is able to maintain her crops easily.

She is asking for a loan through the COMIXMUL cooperative so she can buy coffee compost, fertilizer, plants, and other things to help with her coffee production, so she can have a good harvest and be more attractive to her customers. 

Her plans are to improve and fertilize the soil on which they farm so that her coffee crops keep their foliage and produce a healthy fruit.  This way they will be able to count on a sure harvest.  Her dream, like that of every mother, is to support his son with his studies so that he will graduate from university and not have to deal with the same situation she had to deal with as a child.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 58-year-old married mother of a single child.

Since 1999, Fatima and her husband have worked in the distillation of herbs. It’s their main source of income to support their family.

This is Fatima’s seventh loan cycle with Kiva partner Al Majmoua. She is requesting it in order to buy special herbs and seeds necessary to increase her production. Her clients are her neighbors, relatives, friends and friends of friends, or anyone interested in such an industry.

Fatima is an expert in her work, and that’s what is keeping her strong in the market. She is still hoping to be financially capable of opening her own factory to produce her products under a registered trademark in the future.

loans.use: To buy special herbs, flowers and bottles

loans.name: Paola

texts.es: Paola tiene 27 años, está casada con Juan Manuel y tiene 2 hijos pequeños con quienes vive en su casa propia. Paola se dedica a la agricultura desde los 20 años, cultivando café, plátanos y mango. Cuenta con 5 héctareas de terrenos agrícolas en producción y otras 2 que cultivará en el trascurso de este año. Paola está contenta con la producción de café de este año, ya que cosechó una buena cantidad en está temporada. Ella siembra en varias partes alejadas de su localidad. La calidad del café varía de acuerdo a la altura. Una de sus dificultades es la lejanía de sus cultivos, pero afirma que, sembrando en las partes más altas obtiene más granos de café, pero también requiere de más cuidados y el traslado de sus productos desde esa zona, también implica inversión. Éste es su tercer crédito con KIVA y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Paola, invertirá S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Paola is 27 years old and married to Juan Manuel.  They have two children who live with them in their home.  Paola has been a farmer since she was 20 years old, raising coffee, plantains, and mangos.  She has five hectares of land in production and two others that she will farm this year.  Paola is happy about the coffee production this year, now that she has had a good harvest this season.  She farms in various places around her area and the quality of the coffee is high.  One of the difficulties she faces is the distance between her crops, but she says that she obtains more fruit by planting at the higher elevations, but it requires more care and investment.  This will be her third cycle with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that will allow her to move ahead.  She promises to pay on time and will use the S/3,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana  trabaja como ayundante de albañil, su  nivel de educacion es secundaria, tiene 2 hijos, vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz.

Juana trabaja más de 12 horas al dia para cubrir todos los gastos de su familia, de hecho, ella es el único sustento

Necesita crédito para refaccionar un cuarto de su domicilio, comprará estuco, puerta, pintura y ventanas , asi mejorará  su calidad de vida.

El sueño de Juana es tener  su casa propia para ofreser a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana works as a mason’s helper.  She has a junior high school education, has two children, and lives with her parents in La Paz.

Juana works 12 hours a day to cover all the household expenses, in fact she is their only source of support.

She needs this loan to fix up a room in her house.  She will buy stucco, a door, paint, and windows.  This way her quality of life will improve.  Her dream is to have a house of her own so she can provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline appreciates the previous loan she took from Kiva that helped educate her children who are in school. She has a kiosk business that is doing very well and she wants to add more stock to her business. She is requesting a loan of KES30,000 to purchase wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for her kiosk business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, soap, cooking oil and maize flour for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Sandukht

texts.en:
Sandukht was born in 1964 in Georgia, and when she was 21 years old her family came back to their motherland, where her father built a beautiful house in the village of Ddmashen in the Gegharkunik region. 

For several years Sandukht has worked at the house of culture in their village. She has also worked at the knitting factory. When she got married she became a housewife and she brought up her three nice children (two daughters and a son). Today her daughters are married and they live separately with their families, and her son is now in the military service. 

Sandukht and her husband now have nothing to do but to become fully engaged in farming and agriculture. They cultivate potatoes, beetroot and barley, and on their small farm they also have two cows, a bull, two calves, eight sheep and forty chickens. Sandukht sells all their farm products herself at their village wholesale food market.

She is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams to increase the number of her farm cattle. She has already taken a loan once from Nor Horizon and she is sure that this deal with Kiva lenders will be as productive as the previous one with Nor Horizon.

loans.use: to increase the number of her farm cattle.

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia is the group leader of this four-person lending group. She lives in the remote area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family. She has three children. All are of school-going age. She is a responsible mother and always tries her best to provide better facilities to her children. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. His net income is too low to meet the household needs. 

Rafia's husband owns a french fry shop. His customers love his delicious french fries. Rafia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy potatoes, chilies, spices, oil and ketchup. Rafia will save the profit amount so that her husband can better establish his business. She hopes that thorough this loan her husband would be able to work more efficiently. She is very happy and relaxed after taking this loan.

loans.use: to buy potato, chilies, spices, oil and ketchup

loans.name: Jorge Atilio

texts.es: Jorge de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el se dedica a la venta de futas y verduras vende en su vehículo por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela porque su producto es fresco y a buen precio, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, don Jorge esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras por mayor y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Jorge, 44 years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and his son. He travels selling fruits and vegetables in various neighborhoods close to where he lives. He has a lot of client because his products are fresh and at a good price. With the money he earns at work, he will be able to pay some household bills. Jorge is asking for a loan to buy bulk quantities of fruits and vegetables as well as do some repairs on his car since it’s his only work vehicle. He also wants to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantities of fruits and vegetables to do some repairs on his car.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Jovito

texts.en:
Jovito is a farmer from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of ten children. Jovito has been in the farming business for several years now. 

Jovito is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these supplies, he will be able to improve the productivity of the farm. Jovito hopes to make his business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Noralie

texts.en:
Noralie is 40 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Noralie has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Noralie requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

Noralie has been in this business for six years. In the future, Noralie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

Josephine has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Josephine would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en:
Stepan is 44 years old and lives in Gavar, a city in the region of Gegharkunik. He is married and has two sons. Stepan’s wife works as a teacher at the local school of the arts. Stepan is trained in the veterinary speciality, but he has never worked in his specialty. With the passing of time, he has become an auto mechanic. He works in a rented space where he provides different car-related services. His garage is very popular in his native city and he can remember no time that he was left without work.

Stepan asks for a loan of 500,000 Aremnian drams (AMD) in order to buy some tools and paints that he needs for his everyday repairing and reconstructing jobs.

loans.use: to buy some tools and paints for his business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is very thankful for the loans previously lent to her. She used her loans in her business, and this gave her a good reward. Her income from business assisted her family financially. She used the loan not just in her variety store but also in her food stall. Her husband is also working to help her provide for their everyday expenses.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Delia hopes to expand her business and dreams that her family will always remain in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrodes, paints, a compressor, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Emerita

texts.es: Sonia de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que está cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa blusas, faldas, pantalones, camisas,etc. por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida con su hijo.
texts.en: Sonia, 46 years old, lives in her own home with her son. She’s been working selling clothes for a few years. Her business is in the market close to where she lives. Sonia is asking for a loan to buy more blouses, skirts, pants, shirts, etc. in bulk in order to be able to continue her business and also give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, pants, and shirts in bulk.

loans.name: Vaimoso

texts.en:
Vaimoso is 29 years old and single with no children. She makes and sells elei (traditional printed fabric) to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. 

Vaimoso has requested a loan to buy stencils, materials, paints, brushes and a wooden board design for her printing. She plans to use her profits to provide for her family everyday needs. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy stencils, materials, paints, brushes and a wooden board design

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married with 2 children. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school.  She used to sell palm fruit but currently Sarah sells saucepans in Whindo (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this industry for about 2 years now. Her husband is a contractor.

Sarah's income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.  Sarah will use the loan to increase her existing saucepan capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Sarah plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing saucepan capacity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her existing bowl and plate  capacity
